programme.title: La disparue de Compostelle
programme.desc: Jeanne Nogarède est gendarme en agglomeration rurale dans son village natal de Saint-Guilhem-le-Desert. Laffaire de La disparue de Compostelle est le plus gros regret de sa vie. Le 26 novembre 2020 à 7h30 du matin, Emma Vivian, fille dune de ses amies denfance, est sortie de son domicile pour aller à lecole. On ne la plus jamais revue.

programme.title: La disparue de Compostelle
programme.desc: La video diffusee de la petite Emma fait emerger de nouvelles pistes, notamment un blog anonyme.

programme.title: Vortex
programme.desc: Brest, en 2025. Le capitaine de police Ludovic Beguin enquete sur la mort dune femme retrouvee noyee sur la plage de Corsen. En salle de realite virtuelle pour reetudier la scène de crime capturee par des drones, Ludovic decouvre quil peut entrer en contact avec son epouse Melanie, decedee sur cette meme plage en 1998. Ludovic decide alors de faire limpossible pour sauver la defunte, mais modifier le passe pourrait avoir de graves consequences sur le present.

programme.title: Vortex
programme.desc: Après avoir decouvert que Zoe Levy et Melanie portaient la meme bague lors de leur decès, Ludovic est desormais certain quelles ont ete assassinees par le meme agresseur. Il sinterroge egalement sur lexistence dautres victimes, que personne navait liees à cette affaire jusquici. En parallèle, le changement dattitude de Melanie en 1998 a des consequences devastatrices sur le futur : Nathan, collègue et copain de Ludovic, et Florence, lamie de Melanie, ne se sont pas rencontres.

programme.title: Vortex
programme.desc: Ludovic et Nathan decouvrent que le petit ami violent de Nolwenn, la troisième victime, est le fils dune bijoutière de Brest. Sagirait-il du mysterieux meurtrier à la bague ? Alors que Nathan poursuit cette piste, Ludovic constate avec effroi la disparition de Parvana et de Sam. Il comprend que Melanie, en provoquant une rencontre avec Parvana en 1998, a modifie le futur.

programme.desc: Organisations syndicales, partis politiques, mais aussi mouvements dentrepreneurs prennent la parole.

programme.title: Mort sur terre battue
programme.desc: À l’approche d’un prestigieux tournoi sur terre battue, le corps sans vie de Manon Picard est decouvert sur le court.

programme.title: Florence dans le regard des Medicis
programme.desc: Berceau de la Renaissance, Florence a vu naître des artistes qui façonneront lart, larchitecture et la litterature à partir du 13e siècle jusquà nos jours. Ces genies de lhumanite reunis en un meme lieu et à la meme epoque ont un denominateur commun, une meme cle : Les Medicis...

programme.title: Notre Histoire de France
programme.desc: Dans une France en quete de stabilite après les tumultes revolutionnaires, un jeune general corse emerge : Napoleon Bonaparte. Stratège audacieux et visionnaire, il gravit les echelons du pouvoir à une vitesse fulgurante, remportant des victoires eclatantes, qui font de lui un heros national. Mais, derrière les faits darmes du chef de guerre se dessine une histoire damour aussi passionnee que complexe avec Josephine de Beauharnais. Leur union, marquee par des doutes, des intrigues et une volonte commune de grandeur, devient le socle dune ascension politique inedite.

programme.title: Notre Histoire de France
programme.desc: Après sa brillante victoire à Austerlitz, lEmpereur Napoleon Bonaparte etend sa domination sur lEurope grâce à une serie de triomphes militaires. Cependant, cette gloire cache une ambition devorante qui commence à le consumer. Desormais seul, après sa separation davec Josephine, il doit faire face à son destin. Ses campagnes, de plus en plus perilleuses, affaiblissent son Empire et en revèlent les fragilites.

programme.title: Notre Histoire de France
programme.desc: Depuis 1337, Français et Anglais se disputent le trône de France lors dune guerre interminable : la guerre de Cent Ans. Tout le pays est en proie au chaos lorsquà partir de 1429, une jeune paysanne, surgie de nulle part, galvanise les forces du roi Charles VII, par son audace et sa foi. Elle conduit victorieusement les troupes françaises contre les armees anglaises, fait lever le siège dOrleans et conduit le roi au sacre, à Reims, aidant ainsi à inverser le cours de la guerre. Lhistorienne Claude Gauvard specialiste de lhistoire politique, sociale et judiciaire du Moyen Age, evoque cette figure mythique et tente de retablir la realite historique sous la legende doree.

programme.title: Notre Histoire de France
programme.desc: Au XVIe siècle, protestants et catholiques se livrent une lutte sans merci. En signe dapaisement, la reine Catherine de Medicis offre sa fille Margot en mariage au chef des protestants, Henri de Navarre, le futur Henri IV. Nicolas Le Roux, professeur dhistoire moderne à la Sorbonne et specialiste des guerres de religion dans le royaume de France, evoque cette page sanglante de lHistoire.

programme.title: Ness et Rayan
programme.desc: Ness, capitaine de police, arrete un jour Rayan, un jeune delinquant tchatcheur qui vient de lui voler son portefeuille. Condamne à effectuer un Travail d’Interet General dans un commissariat, Rayan y retrouve avec effroi sa victime dont il devient le chauffeur. Ce duo improbable va peu à peu apprendre à se connaître et à rapprocher la loi et la rue.

programme.title: Meteo Outre-mer
programme.desc: Le point sur levolution de la meteo dans les Outre-mers, grâce à des cartes et des explications.

programme.title: Un dimanche à la campagne
programme.desc: Un moment hors du temps pour se rencontrer et pour parler damour, damitie, de la vie autour dartistes et de Frederic Lopez.

programme.desc: 2005 was supposed to be Microsofts year. The Xbox 360 was a brand new console that would bring gamers together and change the future of home entertainment. Why, then, did Microsoft lose ground in the console wars to Sony and Nintendo?

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: The great empires of the ancient world were created through war, and the most defining battles were fought through siege warfare. From the legendary battle of Troy to the fall of Rome, which siege will top our list for being the most devastating?

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: Tales of Bigfoot sightings are reported globally but the Alaskan version is the most extreme, standing over 14 feet tall. Is this massive, aggressive creature targeting people in the Alaska Triangle?

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: 60BC. Over-powerful generals and money corrupt the Roman Republic. With Rome falling into and out of civil wars, Julius Caesar is to defy all rivals and laws to make himself dictator for life!

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: In Norway, Tim and Gerrard explore a hydroelectric plant where the Nazis were close to producing a nuclear weapon. Mike and James investigate a cabin in the Alps where Hitlers top associate made the ultimate sacrifice.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: Theres a gaping sinkhole at the National Corvette Museum - can a team of engineers fix it? And, what caused the collapse of Minneapolis Metrodomes iconic roof?

programme.title: Serial Killer Earth
programme.desc: Mother Nature unleashes a barrage of attacks around the globe. In San Francisco, an earthquake crushes commuters; a rolling avalanche devours climbers in the Himalayas; and in Nebraska, lightning strikes an unlucky storm chaser.

programme.title: Engineering An Empire
programme.desc: In less than 200 years, the Aztecs went from a tribe of nomads into the most powerful civilisation the New World had ever known. How did they achieve such greatness?

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.desc: A seller comes in with a poster by Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec. Meanwhile, Chum unboxes some 1912 Yale baseball uniforms. Then, Rick takes a look at a ukulele from 1919. And later, testing out a restored Track Rabbit go-kart.

programme.title: The Unbelievable With Dan Aykroyd

programme.desc: A mob-connected heist crew the FBI described as the best ever takes down a Southern California bank in 1972, getting away with millions in cash allegedly linked to President Richard Nixon.

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters

programme.desc: A mob-connected heist crew the FBI described as the best ever takes down a Southern California bank in 1972, getting away with millions in cash allegedly linked to President Richard Nixon.

programme.title: Original Gangsters With Sean Bean
programme.desc: Al Capone, the man who was, in many ways, the gangster archetype from which all subsequent images and ideas were drawn, the man who defied prohibition to bring booze to a thirsty nation, returns to the spotlight 78 years after his death.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: As we make plans to travel beyond the Moon to new worlds, how are we preparing to become human extraterrestrials? Just how will we survive this trip into the unknown?

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters
programme.desc: An advanced submarine is enlisted to probe one of the deepest, darkest parts of the Bermuda Triangle in search of a legendary ship that vanished in 1921. Plus, the possibility that massive bubbles are opening up in the floor of the infamous stretch of sea.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The Fellowship is ecstatic when they uncover another structure in the swamp. And in the Money Pit, evidence suggests they may have come into contact with the elusive Chappell Vault.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: A miraculous meteorite falling from the heavens. A priceless gemstone with a deadly curse. And a chunk of sandstone considered so sacred that wars have been fought to protect it. What is it about stones that inspires some people to worship them?

programme.title: The Unbelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: Searching the world for strange deaths, including a 25-foot molasses tidal wave in Boston, a dancing plague taking 100 lives, surgery with 300% mortality, the 1814 London beer flood, and spontaneous human combustion.

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: A mob-connected heist crew the FBI described as the best ever takes down a Southern California bank in 1972, getting away with millions in cash allegedly linked to President Richard Nixon.

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters
programme.desc: The team searches for an A3 Skywarrior lost off the USS Saratoga in 1960, amid other tragic deaths. Were they linked to Cold War tensions or an old Bermuda Triangle curse?

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While the team continues to chase the elusive tunnel in the Money Pit, evidence that the swamp was used for an off-loading operation abounds, and new clues on Lot 5 point to Captain Phipps.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For centuries, archaeologists have tried to unravel the mysteries of how - and why - certain incredible structures like the Great Pyramid at Giza, the staircase at Loretto Chapel, and Coral Castle were built. Will we ever find the answers?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer walks in with a Tommy Boy film poster signed by actor Chris Farley. Meanwhile, Rick tries not to slip up making a deal on a pair of WW2 snow shoes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick takes a swing at a Honus Wagner baseball card, will it be the real deal? Chum strums a custom Fender by popular guitar maker John Carruthers. Can he pick the right price, or will he end up fretting?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum rack up points testing the merchandise at a pinball paradise; Corey saddles up to a piece of World War II history; Chum sleuths out a sale on a set of Sherlock Holmes books; Rick welcomes Guns N Roses guitarist, ASHBA.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny channels an old friends tactics, allowing him to pick just the right unit; Brandi flexes her muscles on a dusty locker; Ivy does his best to look beneath the surface, while Rene and Casey gamble big on an even bigger room.

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: Hidden dangers once held at bay by humans erupt with catastrophic force—from everyday objects ready to explode to chemical plants and locust plagues—as nature and human legacy collide, these ticking time bombs threaten to send the world up in smoke.

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When Katie Paiges older sister returns for the first time in almost 50 years to the Colorado ranch where they both experienced terrifying unexplained events as children, the ranch reacts.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick takes a Bricklin SV-1 out for a test drive. But is this sports car a safe bet, or a bright yellow lemon? Then, a seller makes Chum a whale-y big offer, but does he have the backbone to make the deal?

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters
programme.desc: Did a Bermuda Triangle tsunami claim two behemoth ships, or did they fall prey to Nazi U-Boats? The team sets its sights on a famous Bermuda Triangle case: the twin vanishings of two massive cargo ships. In November-December 1941, the massive USS Proteus disappears after crossing the Bermuda Triangle. Then two weeks later, without warning, a second nearly-identical giant ship, the USS Nereus, also drops off the earth. Divers Mike Barnette and Jimmy Gadomski dive into the abyss searching for these missing ships, while the land team follows clues that lead them from tidal waves, to Nazi U-Boats, and ultimately to one of their biggest finds.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While Gary and Rick uncover unprecedented finds in the swamp, the team finally reaches depth in the Garden Shaft and their probe drilling operation delivers thrilling results immediately.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: A dog with the ability to detect cancer. A horse that can read minds. Birds that sense future disasters. What gives animals these extraordinary powers?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things go nuclear when a Japanese Godzilla toy hits the counter. Chum does battle over a leather jacket from WWII. A Godfather video display illuminates the pawn shop. A Johnny Drama whiskey bottle tries to join Chums entourage.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller comes in with a poster by Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec. Meanwhile, Chum unboxes some 1912 Yale baseball uniforms. Then, Rick takes a look at a ukulele from 1919. And later, testing out a restored Track Rabbit go-kart.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: From a 500-ton stone believed to represent an ancient UFO, to giant statues said to have been created with advanced technology. Could these extraordinary standing stones provide evidence of extraterrestrial visitation?

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When Investigator Katie Paige rejoins Andy and Paul at a Colorado ranch where strange phenomena terrorized her as a child, a newly revealed site of concentrated activity results in the discovery of a possible portal above the ranch.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Modern prophets. Catastrophic premonitions. Dreams of crimes to come. Can people really predict the future or will time forever be a mystery?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: Exploring underground structures; including the Longyou Grottoes in China, believed to be over 15,000 years old, secret tunnels linked to Native American lore of the Ant and Snake People, ancient libraries from a lost civilisation; and more.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While Gary and Rick uncover unprecedented finds in the swamp, the team finally reaches depth in the Garden Shaft and their probe drilling operation delivers thrilling results immediately.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Modern prophets. Catastrophic premonitions. Dreams of crimes to come. Can people really predict the future or will time forever be a mystery?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making paper planes but Timmy needs some help from Finlay. Help Timmy decide which transport comes next.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: When Mayor Oki wants to build new tower Messy is keen to help. There is just one problem, all his towers fall over...

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its wash day in Okido. Messy travels with Zoe and Felix to the Okido llaundrette and learns just how much soap can be too much. Soon Okido is covered in bubbles and its up to Messy to clean up.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Huckleberry and Blueberry’s Patti Persimmon-style mystery story is rejected by the online mystery magazine, Strawberry comes up with a new way to raise funds for Huck’s pet shelter—a big dog show! Plum attempts to turn the dog show into an extravagant dance performance. The competition heats up, everyone wanting their pup to perform in an even more spectacular manner, and the dog training sessions go comically awry. Meanwhile Huck and Blueberry co-write a monster mystery, inadvertently starting a rumor that a Berry Patch monster is loose! The rumor, combined with Jadeybug from the post office forgetting to send out the show invitations, results in no one coming to the show. Fortunately, Blueberry had submitted her and Huck’s new mystery story to the online magazine, and the editor is thrilled with their work.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is pleased when he wins a game he is playing with Nana so he visits Dino-World where he makes up lots of games and wins every time.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to do lots of things all at once so instead of choosing one activity he goes to Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah is about to dive into the water from a boat but then she encounters a fishing line got caught up on a sawfishs snout. Back in the garden, Hero is attempting to saw a log with a saw, but Katie points out its an actual toy saw and Leo has been wasting his time. Leo then receives a call from Farah, informing them of the animal she encounter. The Junior Rangers learns more of the animal back in their treehouse and later agree to meetup to help Farah. The Junior Rangers arrived to Farahs location, and discuss a plan to look for the poor animal. Farah, Leo and Hero would be diving underwater while Katie look with using a camera she controls with her tablet. They found the animal afterwards but it was too fast for them to catch up. The Junior Rangers then meet up with Ranger Rocky and explain their situation, which he calls for Ranger Joey for much needed information on the animal. After learning a useful tip from Ranger Joey, they attempt to use its electroreception to bait the animal, via using PlatypusOne. They managed to trick it, causing Leo and Farah able to remove the fishing line from the sawfish. They day is safe and the Junior Rangers went home. Back in the garden, Leo sees that Ranger Rocky is actually sawing some logs with an actual saw.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Philip shows off to James about how many trucks he can pull, James decides to prove that he is the stronger engine by pulling a very long train. Soon disaster strikes as James can’t control all of the trucks and comes off the rails breaking through the side of a stone bridge. Philip races to save James and the brave little engine slips under James to rescue his new friend from falling and props him up until help arrives.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sidney is a very hard working diesel, but he’s also very forgetful. One day The Fat Controller gives him a very special job – Sidney needs to go to Brendam Docks to collect Percy’s new wheels. But when Sidney admits that he’s worried he might forget what he has to do, Thomas suggests making up a little song to help him remember. Sidney goes off happily singing a song about collecting a crate from Brendam docks, but when he stops to talk to Gordon he gets distracted, forgets what he’s supposed to be doing, and ends up at The Waste Dump looking for boilers then The Animal Park waiting for an elephant!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: At the request of Emma the forest ranger, Grisu has to tag the sick trees in the forest. The trees must absolutely be cut down before the storm arrives. But all the marks he makes are erased by a mysterious eraser: Fume, who is determined to defend his tree. Grisu finds a solution by using his father to replant the tree sheltered from the wind.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Olivia competes in the famous Sand Dune Race in a new electric 4x4 she has designed, but her co-pilot has just pulled out. Fortunately, Grisu will take his place. Accompanied by Fume and Stella, he joins Olivia in the desert. The race begins and soon Slad and Vlad - better known as “The Tricktwins” - give them a hard time. The twins, ready to do anything to win, try to trick them. While Grisu and Olivias charred windsceen prevents them from moving forward, Grisu has an idea that allows them to get back in the race. Before crossing the finish line, they even help the Tricktwins to get out of a quicksand.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson and Brewster forget their fire safety rules during a drill and miss out on earning their badges – but they learn from their mistakes and when there’s a real fire, they know just what to do.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy bit off more than they can chew! They have picked so many plums that the Fox-Badger family will never be able to eat them all before they rot… Margaret asks the children to find solutions to avoid such a waste. Our three little heroes first think of giving them away to the neighbors, but there’s still plenty of plums left.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are creating a Soft Play Cafe for Chef Tattie in an old warehouse by the docks, ready for an opening party tomorrow. Though the build is on track, Chef can’t decide what colour to paint the disco room so Bob offers to put up paint samples for him to choose from. Leo shows off his ‘mash-up’ app and Tattie decides that Leo should DJ for the party. However, Leo isn’t as confident as he appeared to Chef and the extra responsibility distracts him from the build. Eventually he ends up walking through spilled paint after putting up the colour samples, leaving differently coloured footprints all over the floor.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo is late as he’s overslept thanks to staying up late playing a fishing game on his phone. Bob, Lofty, Leo and Wendy are installing a satellite dish and at the Spring City News HQ located at the docks. The dish has to be in place in time for the Six O’Clock News bulletin. En route to site the team stop to say hello to the Spring City Rockets who are practicing in preparation for a dance show later that day which will be covered on the news. On site Leo and Lofty are teamed up. During the build Leo is distracted by the game; Lofty suggests he should pay more attention. While tying the dish to Lofty’s hook Leo - distracted by the game - does not secure it properly. As Lofty raises the dish it comes loose and drops to the floor.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. They discover the dolly inside a grand piano thats playing a few sour notes./Cars are disappearing from a particular parking space, Huckle and gang set out to find out why.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the South African desert just before dawn, Jane and Zumi discover construction signs for a road and find some squeaking Desert Rain Frogs. In the Garden, Hero wakes Leo and Katie, sleeping in their sleeping bags, by chewing on his squeaky toy. Jane calls them and Katie provides information about the unique frogs through the computer. Concerned about the frogs displaced burrows due to construction, the rangers travel to Jane. They gather the frogs for relocation, Hero gets a little too playful with the frogs and they make their way to find the perfect place for the frogs. They meet Ranger Rocky at a meerkat burrow, who calls Ranger Joey. She provides insights into the frogs behavior and suggests a suitable environment. Meanwhile, Hero goes missing, and Janes keen hearing locates him. They find Hero near a perfect spot for the frogs, a sandy area with a termite mound. The frogs are released, and thunder rumbles, marking the beginning of the rainy season. In the Garden, Leo and Katie grant Hero some well-deserved playtime.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo embarks on a challenging solo mission, The Mata-Mata Mission, to return a rehabilitated Mata-Mata turtle to its rainforest habitat in South America, struggling with a heavy trolley and realizes, he’s missing the map! In the garden, Katie surprises Leo by hiding in a pile of leaves which ends up with the leaves all messed up. Katie is about to rake them when they receive a call from Peyo. They travel to South America to assist Peyo with his mission. After considering various relocation options, they seek guidance from Ranger Joey, learning about the turtles preference for still, warm water. They accidentally push the trolley into a lake and the Mata-Mata is nowhere to be found but soon realizes that its ability to perfectly camouflage in the lake means they have found its new home. Back in the garden, Hero ambushes Katie by hiding in a pile of leaves.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the park, Simon and Gaspard are playing tag. But since Gaspard slips through a concrete tunnel that is way too narrow for Simon, the two brothers start bickering. And since Simon says that Gaspard is being a baby, Gaspard doesn’t want to play with his brother any more. He’d rather go off to sulk! Pffffft, what a poopy sulker! Simon grabs the ball and decides to go play by himself. Except that he sends it flying back into the very narrow tunnel and...it gets stuck! Simon runs to Gaspard to ask for help getting it out but Gaspard refuses, he is still sulking.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The little friends decide to get rid of their old, unwanted items and organize a yard sale in the meadow. The old items lead to a lively barter, but a large pile of useless junk remains. The rubbishtruck of the quick beetles arrives to help, taking away the remaining items and assisting in cleaning the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, finds a strange little fish in the stream, which turns out to be a lost polliwog. Although Alfonso is sad when the polliwog returns to its frog family, their friendship doesnt end. Alfonso visits his tadpole friend every day, who soon develops into a real little frog.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Eddy, the potato beetle, notices he cant see well from a distance, so on Dollys advice, he visits Dr. Owl. Eddy needs glasses, so he and Dolly visit Fly Flynn, the optician. Eddy is delighted to rediscover the joy of sharp vision and can finally see the birds lively concert clearly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert has always dreamed of living in the woods. And Tilda thinks wishes like that should be fulfilled. So Tilda, Rupert and Molly set out to spend a night in the forest. Rupert is amused by all the luggage the ladies are taking with them – for him, the woods have everything one could need! He soon discovers that its not that easy...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is expecting Rupert to breakfast, but the hedgehog doesnt turn up. So Tilda goes to Ruperts house, where Edna tells her that Rupert has gone into the village. The mouse finds it odd that Rupert has forgotten their arrangement and sets off after him.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: The Triplets

programme.desc: Caillou feels intimidated when Billy, Clementine’s brother, shows off some super cool moves at the skate park. Caillou pretends to be Skip Super, facing off against Giant Rexy while helping new superhero, Kick-Flip (Billy), overcome his feelings of inadequacy to help save the day.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou gets carried away with generosity when at the neighbourhood Give and Take and he gives Rosie’s doll away without asking. In a Pirate fantasy where his treasure is given to a sea monster, Caillou learns that it’s not right to give things away that don’t belong to you.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Phillip, the little diesel boxcab, arrives at Knapford full of energy and enthusiasm. When Gordon tells Phillip how fast he is, Phillip is determined to prove that he is faster and challenges him to a race. Unfortunately Gordon is resting on the siding when Phillip comes over and when the express engine tells Phillip to “go away”, he thinks it’s a challenge and races off. When he gets to the other end of the line and Gordon still hasn’t overtaken him, Phillip assumes he’s won, causing Gordon to show him just how fast he really can be. Phillip is very impressed, but he is not in the least disheartened as he believes he still beat Gordon the first time.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: ‘We’re under attack by aliens!’ or so Kai thinks when he finds a mysterious crop circle underwater. They later realise that the hardworking white-spotted pufferfish is responsible for the intricate circle, but an uncontactable Kai is already on his way to destroy it, thinking it would prevent an alien attack. The rangers are on it!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai needs a photo of the majestic Golden Pheasant for a photography competition. But no flash photography please!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The Train Station in Pencaster is getting a brand new stained glass window but, um, the locals think that the new modern art window isnt all that great.. Pats job is to deliver it but when it gets a dangerous crack in it during the journey Ajay says he cant accept the delivery. Its a Special Delivery: Mission Not Accomplished! Oh dear! Pat knows exactly who to ask for help and the children of Greendale School find their gorgeious mosaic picture of Greendale comes in very handy.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Mrs Goggins has organised a fun sculpture trail, and lots of people have made sculptures.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its a windy day, and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop.

programme.title: Badanamu Pop
programme.desc: Hop, pop and party with Bada and his adorable friends in a series of exciting singalongs that are as educational as they are fun!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie are preparing to race in the Big City Go-Kart Race. But Oswald is so busy helping his friends get ready, he misses the start. He trails, but catches up quickly as everyone else’s go-karts fall apart. Oswald gives them all a lift and they cross the finish line together to share first prize - a trophy full of ice cream.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald wakes up to hear the sounds of a parade passing outside his window. He and Weenie persuade Henry and Daisy to come to the parade, where Oswald promises them all kinds of exciting sights. But it turns out there is no parade - just Steve Tree carrying a radio. Henry and Daisy are annoyed that Oswald got them all worked up for nothing. But Oswald tells them they can have their own parade, and he organises a makeshift band to march through Big City Park.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team have been busy building a new water park, “Spring City Splash” that includes a wave pool and splash zone. Now there is only one thing left to build... the double dragon water slide. Scoop loves dragons and cannot wait to help build the slides, but when he is asked to help build the support beams instead, he is less than impressed with his job. As Bob attaches the new water park entrance sign, Scoop digs foundations for the support beams. Suddenly Scoop becomes distracted with the arrival of the dragon slides and doesn’t finish the foundations. He attempts to see the dragon slides only to be sent back to finish his job. Now totally eager to get to the slides, Scoop rushes to complete his job and doesn’t realise that the support beams are not set and are beginning to lean.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo and Muck are having great fun playing the very latest computer game “Space Robots!” Bob reminds them they’ve got an early start in the morning. Muck pleads to stay up a bit longer and Leo promises they’ll get a good night’s sleep…just as soon as they reach the top level of the game. But at dawn they’re still playing! Next morning, Leo and Muck are very tired and sleepy. Bob explains that they have to finish building The Spring City Wheel, a huge Ferris-wheel, in the Docklands Regeneration Area. He’s promised the Spring City Rockets they’ll be the first to ride on it - today! Bob and the gang drive towards the site but on the way Muck and Leo stop to have a quick nap.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are playing pirates. Where is the treasure in the garden?

programme.title: Badanamu Pop
programme.desc: Hop, pop and party with Bada and his adorable friends in a series of exciting singalongs that are as educational as they are fun!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But the coupons never arrive. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the day of Mayor Okis Ice-skate Skate-tacular. Only there is too much ice and its stopping everyone from getting to the show! Messy must find away to metl the ice and save the show.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is in the kitchen making a jam sandwich. He jumps to grab the sandwich from the side but accidentally loses his grip - whoops! Poor Messy, his sandwich is all over the floor! “But why do things always fall down and not up?” he asks and transports himself to Okido to find out. In Okido, Messy joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are stargazing at the night sky. They spot a shooting star. As it zips across the sky it starts to get bigger in size. Now it’s travelling towards them! “Duck”, shouts Messy, as it lands right in front of them.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Plum’s plan to direct a small, simple fairytale play as a surprise performance for the Baby Berrykins snowballs out of control when she hears of the same play being done on a grand scale in Berry Big City. Not listening to Strawberry’s advice to keep it simple, she becomes convinced that unless her production is as big, she’ll be the laughing stock of the berry bitty theatrical world! Casting the girls and Berrykins as stage stars in a sendup of “Snow White and the Seven Dwarves,” Plum attempts to match the spectacular stage effects of a big city theater.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A preschool boy named Harry receives a bucket full of toy dinosaurs. This bucket holds a secret --- by using its power, Harry can travel with his dinosaurs to an amazing land of imagination called Dino World.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry thinks his delicious cookie has been stolen he goes to Dino-World where he plays at being a detective searching for the thief.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is cleaning the ocean floor underwater when he later stumble upon a sea cucumber that piques his interest. Then an incident occurs causing the animal to be trapped under a pile of rocks. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing rescue with a plastic crab with their inflatable pool. Leo is using his jetpack and a rope with a bucket to pickup the toy crab but it doesnt work. They tried asking for Heros help but he ignores them. Leo then receives a call from Kai, asking the Junior Rangers help to safe the sea cucumber. After learning more of the animal from Katies computer, the Junior Rangers travel to Kais location. They arrived and immediately ask Kai of the situation. Kai explain and they decide to remove the rocks one by one until succession. Then Ranger Rocky arrives with a sea turtle and the Junior Rangers explain of their situation which Ranger Rocky calls up Ranger Joey. Ranger Joey gives out helpful information where the Junior Rangers used in returning the sea cucumber back in its habitat.

programme.title: Woozle şi Pip
programme.desc: Woozle and Pip are star gazing and imagine jumping from star to star. When one of the stars vanishes they fall and turn into stars themselves. They are star friends now. They imagine all the stars are friends.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Christmas is fast approaching and it is the last chance for children to post their letters to Santa. Percy is collecting the mail, but there is a lot of snow on the rails and it isn’t easy to get through. Harold teasing Percy doesn’t help either, but when Percy runs into a snowdrift it is Harold who volunteers to take the letters for him. Percy is cross at having to be helped, but when Harold doesn’t come back it is Percy who goes to find out what happened and help him in return.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Philip spots Toby and assumes that he is a diesel boxcab just like him. Convinced that they will become best friends, Philip rushes up to introduce himself, but Toby finds him rather overwhelming. Philip is very persistent and manages to get Toby to have a race with him, but Toby doesn’t like it very much. Philip gets upset and thinks Toby doesn’t like him, but with a little help he eventually learns that you can be friends with someone who doesn’t like the same things you like.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A rare bird, the Picking Bird, is in the forest for a very short time, and Dr. Natureza wants to be the first to take a photo. But she caught a terrible cold, so it will be up to Grisù to help her as a wildlife photographer. Exploring the forest is an exciting adventure for Grisù and Stella, but the mysterious bird isn’t easy to spot. Plus Fume, who’s searching ingredients for a dragon recipe, unintentionally messes up with Grisù’s mission. In the end, however, Grisù understands that the bird is attracted by sparkling stuff. So he comes up with an inventive way to take the perfect picture just before sunset.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to babysit and feed a little sea lion while Dr. Natureza is healing its mother. They must prevent the cub from reaching the sea and get lost, but the baby is pretty lively and the mission is not so easy. When the sea lion goes missing, a quest begins. Eventually, the little dragon realizes that the sea lions are very sociable animals, and they love to play, so he will create an improvised fun fair to get the cub back, avoiding other getaways.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy Extras Pe
programme.desc: Discover new words and join in the activities with Timmy and his friends in this fun learning series developed by Aardman and the British Council, world expects in teaching English.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn his badge, Wilson must show that he knows how to recognise destination icons. He gets distracted by following a butterfly and totally forgets where he is supposed to be going. After running around to some wrong locations, he finally concentrates really hard, and remembers he was supposed to be going to the foundry.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: In the morning, Rosie discovers that its Grandparents Day,which she had totally forgotten! But Grandpa and Grandma Fox are coming for dinner and she is intent on making a gift for them. She decides to create a show with the help of her sister, her brothers and Edmund. It will be The Three Little Badgers. Alas, nothing goes as Rosie hoped. The show is soon at risk, as Edmund, who was supposed to play the Big Bad Hurricane mustleave to help Casimir fix a collapsed dam.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a solar panel demonstration, Mayor Madison decrees that the Sea Life Center will be entirely powered by renewable energy. Bob and the team must build a wind farm, which excites Scoop - he cant wait to see the spinny things going round. As they begin construction, Mr Bentley arrives and pulls Bob away, enthusing about other renewable energy schemes they have planned. Spring City will need more energy as it grows, so they need to think ahead. Scoop decides he should think ahead like Mr Bentley suggests, and convinces Lofty to move some of the turbines closer together.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob announces there’s been a Spring City Clock Competition to design the new Spring City Clock – and guess who’s won? The Spring City Rockets! Bob shows the Machines their winning design and explains that metal figures will emerge and sound the bells on the clock. Wendy has been welding the metal figures together. Leo arrives and is looking forward to helping Bob with the decorative cladding around the clock tower but Bob tells him it’s Recycling Day today and his job is to take all the recycling to the Centre first. Bob and the Machines set off to the site while Leo and Muck gather up the boxes of recycling from around the Yard. But Leo is in such a hurry that he mistakes the box with the metal figures in for recycling and dumps it at the Recycling Centre.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Zari scoops up water into her bucket to fill onto her sandcastles moat, she accidentally picks up a lost clown fish in the process. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a try not to laugh challenge, where the opposing side try to make the other person laugh with bad jokes. Katie laughs at a scene of Hero being goofy, which Leo counts as him winning. Leo then receives a call from Zari, informing him of the animal she discovers. After Katie and Leo learn more about the animal on Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Zari to return it to its habitat. Once in the ocean, they try swimming with it and let it go free, but this attracts the attention of a stingray. Leo saves the clownfish and put it back inside the bucket. They then meet up with Ranger Rocky, where they share their issue with the situation. Ranger Rocky calls up Ranger Joey, the ranger with the helpful information. After Ranger Joey debrief them of helpful info, Ranger Rocky excuse himself away as he has to deal with a school of dolphin. The Junior Rangers then finally found the sea anemone and returns the clownfish to its home. The day is safe and they return home. Back in the garden, Katie manages to make Leo laughs with a joke she comes up with.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah is about to dive into the water from a boat but then she encounters a fishing line got caught up on a sawfishs snout. Back in the garden, Hero is attempting to saw a log with a saw, but Katie points out its an actual toy saw and Leo has been wasting his time. Leo then receives a call from Farah, informing them of the animal she encounter. The Junior Rangers learns more of the animal back in their treehouse and later agree to meetup to help Farah. The Junior Rangers arrived to Farahs location, and discuss a plan to look for the poor animal. Farah, Leo and Hero would be diving underwater while Katie look with using a camera she controls with her tablet. They found the animal afterwards but it was too fast for them to catch up. The Junior Rangers then meet up with Ranger Rocky and explain their situation, which he calls for Ranger Joey for much needed information on the animal. After learning a useful tip from Ranger Joey, they attempt to use its electroreception to bait the animal, via using PlatypusOne. They managed to trick it, causing Leo and Farah able to remove the fishing line from the sawfish. They day is safe and the Junior Rangers went home. Back in the garden, Leo sees that Ranger Rocky is actually sawing some logs with an actual saw.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is cleaning the ocean floor underwater when he later stumble upon a sea cucumber that piques his interest. Then an incident occurs causing the animal to be trapped under a pile of rocks. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing rescue with a plastic crab with their inflatable pool. Leo is using his jetpack and a rope with a bucket to pickup the toy crab but it doesnt work. They tried asking for Heros help but he ignores them. Leo then receives a call from Kai, asking the Junior Rangers help to safe the sea cucumber. After learning more of the animal from Katies computer, the Junior Rangers travel to Kais location. They arrived and immediately ask Kai of the situation. Kai explain and they decide to remove the rocks one by one until succession. Then Ranger Rocky arrives with a sea turtle and the Junior Rangers explain of their situation which Ranger Rocky calls up Ranger Joey. Ranger Joey gives out helpful information where the Junior Rangers used in returning the sea cucumber back in its habitat.

programme.title: Badanamu Nursery Rhymes
programme.desc: Learning English from nursery rhyme and rhythm, sounds and syllables with the Badanamus.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon’s friend Ferdinand brings over his new truck to play with. But when Gaspard gets on Ferdinand’s nerves, he comes up with the most ridiculous thing to make Gaspard leave!

programme.title: Badanamu Nursery Rhymes
programme.desc: Learning English from nursery rhyme and rhythm, sounds and syllables with the Badanamus.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble is peacefully resting in the meadow when a bored cloud playfully pours rain on him, making the rose beetle angry. When Bubble tries to catch the cloud, he gets hurt. The cloud regrets its prank and apologizes. To make amends, it offers to fly Bubble over the forest, who happily waves to his friends from above. By the end of the adventure, the cloud and Bubble become good friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The owl chicks dont understand why the mirror copies them. Mama Owl brings them a new mirror but accidentally places it opposite the old one, so the little owls marvel as they multiply in it. Doctor Owl securely attaches the new mirror in the nursery, where the chicks can play and have fun.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends spend the afternoon playing hide and seek. Berry hides so well among the water lily petals that he falls asleep and drifts away on the water. Luckily, the Moon Beetle and the Moon itself help him get back home. The next day, all the little friends play a big game of hide and seek together in the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanley, the stag beetle, and his friends excitedly try out the new traffic park, practicing the rules of the road with roller skates, scooters, bicycles, and small motorcycles. However, Balthazar, the bee, ignores the signs and causes a minor accident by driving recklessly. With the help of the Queen Ant, the little friends learn traffic rules and signs so they can play safely and happily together.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In the fall, the chimney sweep smoke beetle visits the forest friends to clean their chimneys. In Patricks chimney, he finds a shiny hair clip that turns out to be a gift Dolly sent to Katie via Pigeon Post. The friends solve the mystery together, and Katie finally receives the shiny hair clip.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends are picking apples when an old steam locomotive appears on the hill. At the request of the scarlet beetle train engineer, the little friends help repair the locomotive and paint the wagons in bright colors. The cinnabar beetle thanks them by taking them on a special train trip to the great waterfall. The friends enjoy the journey and have a fun day together. At the end of the trip, they happily return home with the colorful train.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda wants to open a hotel so that people from far afield can spend time in beautiful Wild Rose Lane. Rupert thinks its a bad idea, but Tilda sticks to her guns. Then the first guests arrive at Hotel Appleseed, a frog and his son. But instead of being quiet and polite, the guests turn Tildas house on its head. Soon she is rushed off her feet with work.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, a mouse called Ferdinand Pearstalk turns up on Tildas doorstep and announces that he will be taking over her house: the vicar has swapped churches and with him the church mouse. To Tildas amazement, he immediately moves in. With a heavy heart, Tilda puts all her stuff on a handcart and trundles off.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert teaches the kids how to find one’s way through the forest. But as they search their way home, Rupert falls asleep. The kids follow their tracks and also help Rupert find his way back.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is very excited about the idea of seeing lots of animals when he goes on a school outing with his class, but all he finds on the trip at first is rain and a beetle!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a greater mouse-deer back to its home in the rainforest. But can the Junior Rangers rescue the mouse-deer when it gets caught in an animal trap?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees are trying for their Starmap badges as they learn to navigate by the stars. Wilson and Koko quickly learn to identify the constellations – but Brewster just can’t see them. Eventually, by concentrating hard and using his imagination, he finally manages to see the ‘pictures’ in the constellations. He follows his Starmap and meets up with Koko and Wilson in Old Town where Olwin is waiting for them.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Wilson and Brewster must rescue Emery, who will pretend to be broken down in a tunnel. They spend so much time bickering that a fed up Emery drives off. It looks like Wilson and Brewster won’t earn their badges – until there’s a power cut causing a real emergency. They work together and rescue a now genuinely stranded Emery!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are playing in the cottage when a big boom startles them. Running out onto the terrace, they find a stunned sparrow: it’s obvious the small bird flew into the window and has gotten a big bump from the collision! Dad insists the animal needs peace and quiet in order to recover. T’choupi and Nina set themselves the mission of tending to the wounded bird. But disruptions in the cottage, such as a fleeing goat and a chasing cat, make their task way more difficult than expected! Will T’choupi and Nina manage to help the sparrow fly again?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi spots a baby rabbit at the edge of the garden. Taking pity on this lone animal, he decides he wants to keep it. So he introduces it to Plume and Plumeau, hoping they’ll all play together. But despite his good intentions, T’choupi realizes before long that you can’t just invite any random guest into your home…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a special kind of hide And seek, using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic kookoo greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Tomorrow, were going to have a photo workshop! announces Anna, because Charleys mum is coming with a... magic camera! Impatient, Charley and Louis, who are having a snack at Charleys, want nothing more than to discover the powers of this strange camera before the others do! They steal it and secretly start taking a series of funny photos! Suddenly theres panic as one photo is blocked... Theyve broken the camera!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia found a gift in her mothers closet and she thinks it is hers. With Sams help, our impatient Julia tries to figure out what is in the package but destroy a part of it. How to it back as it was?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Around the World: Sam dreams of travelling the world, so he and Julia turn the Mouse Mansion into a global adventure. (S1, ep 14)

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Shane is having too much fun to stop and refuel; that is, until he runs out of coal and is stranded in the hot, red desert.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas misses his best friend Percy while working on the Chinese railway.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous friends come to his house for a fun and spooky Halloween party.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets to choose one toy from the store, but there are so many cool toys to pick from!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is trying to fall asleep but monkey continuously disturbs him. Mole appears and tells them that the sounds of the ocean are known to having a calming effect. They fly to the ocean and bump into what appears to be an island, but is soon revealed as an opera singing whale on her way to choir practice. They dive after her and invite her to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey created a banana peels hat for national hat day but it fall apart, Monkey needs new inspiration. Mole appears and shares how Moose has incredible antlers on his head which can extend up to many feet. They venture off to the tundra to look for Moose. Monkey helps free the moose from some bushes and then invites him to a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James plans a cafe makeover for the Wholefish Cafe, he becomes over-zealous which leads to a series of events that cause a fire. Meawhile, the fire team undertake training on the fire station emergency slide, but Steele is a bit nervous.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a wildlife sketching trip, Norman wants to find the most spectacular creature to sketch, but this gets a bit tricky when Lily Chen tags along.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin and Bear find a treasure map and get their fathers to help them search for the treasure. Though everyone thinks they should turn back, Franklin urges them forward, finally finding the prize./Bear and Mr. Owl take on Franklin and Mr. Groundhog in a Bumpy Buggy race. Only when they listen to each other do Franklin and Mr. Groundhog win the final round with a new trick from Franklin.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger wants to sleep under the stars. Rosie is all for it, but Woodsy would rather not, confessing that he is scared. First,Scoutbadger makes fun of Woodsy, who doesn’t want to go with them. But as night falls, Scoutbadger grows scared. He believes he has seen a yellow-eyed monster and runs away, soon getting lost. Actually, the monster was only Edmund and Woodsy, who had discreetly come to see if everything wasgoing well.

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave listen out for some very strange noises in Hatty’s garden. Who or what is making the ‘Bang-Bang, Ting-ting-a-ling and Ratta-tat-tat’ sounds and will Dave’s ‘Blue Panda Idea,’ stop them from keeping Hatty awake at night?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Mr and Mrs Rabbit and the three Little Bunnies move to a new burrow. But Littlest Bunny doesn’t want to go; and keeping track of all the bunnies’ belongings turns out to be hard work. Tweet has to reassure Littlest Bunny that his favourite cuddly carrot toy will be delivered safely and that he will love his new home.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants to show Big Nutbrown Hare something special too, something he has never seen before. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry visits his distant relative, Snail Sam.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey cant seem to slow down. Mole then appears and tells them about the snail who is known for being very slow. Parrot immediately suggests they go to the Meadow. Soon they are all playing a slow-mo version of Monkey See Monkey Do.

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Professor Pickles decides to create an EPIC historical walking trail, he doesnt realise that his decision to use real props instead of cardboard ones will result in an emergency of EPIC proportions!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s new leggings are too big for her. She wishes she didn’t have to wait to grow bigger. In Mimiloo, Boomer also wishes he was bigger—so he could be faster in Tack’s obstacle course! When he gets ahold of Tack’s Sizerchanger invention, he becomes huge! It’s up to Kate to convince Boomer that he’s better off being Boomer-sized.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to make friends with the man in the moon. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim accidentally blast off in Tack’s new rocket ship! When they land, they meet Rumbly, a little guy made of rocks—who must be the man in the moon! Kate and Mim-Mim must help him repair his house and find their way back to Mimiloo.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is picnic in the forest day! And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her shameful secret…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother.
